## Overview

Beebot is a sophisticated autonomous mobile robot system designed for indoor navigation and autonomous operations. This documentation provides comprehensive information about the system's components, APIs, tutorials, and hardware integration.

## Key Features

:::{.grid}
:::{.g-col-md-6}
### üéØ Advanced Navigation
- **Monte Carlo Localization (MCL)** with expansion resetting
- **A* Global Planning** with configurable heuristics  
- **Dynamic Window Approach (DWA)** for local obstacle avoidance
- **Real-time mapping** with ray casting algorithms
:::

:::{.g-col-md-6}
### üîß System Integration
- **Multi-sensor fusion** (LiDAR, IMU, Odometry)
- **Hardware integration** with Arduino controllers
- **Remote control** via Xbox gamepad
- **MQTT communication** for wireless monitoring
:::
:::

## System Architecture

```mermaid
graph TB
    subgraph "SLAM & Localization"
        ALS[Advanced Localization System]
        EMCL[Expanded MCL]
        RM[Ray Casting Mapping]
        ICP[ICP Matching]
    end
    
    subgraph "Motion Planning"
        AStar[A* Global Planner]
        DWA[DWA Local Planner]
        WM[Waypoint Manager]
        NU[Navigation Utils]
    end
    
    subgraph "Control Systems"
        RC[Remote Control]
        AI[Arduino Interface]
        RE[Robot Eyes]
    end
    
    subgraph "System Integration"
        LC[Launch Configuration]
        RV[RViz Visualization]
        SYS[System Monitor]
    end
    
    subgraph "Hardware"
        LIDAR[2D LiDAR]
        IMU[IMU Sensor]
        ENC[Encoders]
        ARD[Arduino]
        GP[Xbox Gamepad]
    end
    
    LIDAR --> ALS
    IMU --> EMCL
    ENC --> AStar
    ARD --> AI
    GP --> RC
    
    ALS --> DWA
    AStar --> DWA
    WM --> AStar
    RC --> DWA
```
